title: Radio 4 turns lost Hollywood scripts into audio dramas for Unmade Movies series - Movies
text: For every script that Hollywood turns into a movie, there are so many more that go unmade... until now.Radio 4 has unearthed a load of "lost" scripts from the likes of Arthur Miller, Orson Welles, Alfred Hitchcock and Harold Pinter, and adapted them for the radio. © Getty Images / Mike Marsland/WireImageJames McAvoy James McAvoy will be taking on the role of Charles Marlow from Joseph Conrad's novel Heart of Darkness. The original film script was adapted by Orson Wells, but it was thought to be too extravagant at the time.The Blind Man, by Ernest Lehman and Alfred Hitchcock, has been directed by Mark Gatiss who made a very interesting casting decision. © Getty Images / David M. BenettDavid Suchet "And in The Blind Man, Mark Gatiss, who directs, decided to cast the Narrator as Alfred Hitchcock. So we asked Peter Serafinowicz to read it as him. He does an uncanny impression!" producer Laurence Bowen told Wired.Hugh Laurie, David Suchet, Tim Pigott-Smith, Elliot Cowan and Rebecca Front are among the actors taking part in the series.Arthur Miller's The Hook kicks the series off on Saturday (October 17) at 2.30pm on Radio 4.
